alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 2:20PM EDT until May 26 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Miami-Dade County in southeastern Florida... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 220 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Zoo Miami, Princeton, and other neighboring localities. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 3 to 5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rainfall from thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... The Redland, Kendall, Richmond West, Goulds, Country Walk, Zoo Miami, Princeton, West Perrine, Richmond Heights, Cutler Bay, Palmetto Bay, South Miami Heights, Inlikita, Three Lakes and Palmetto Estates. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...3-5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
